meanings.definition: A simple sugar that cannot be hydrolyzed to give a simpler sugar.
meanings.sent1: Glucose is a monosaccharide found in fruits.
meanings.sent2: Monosaccharides are the building blocks of carbohydrates.
meanings.sent3: Why did the monosaccharide break up with the disaccharide? They couldn't find a sweet connection.
meanings.sent4: The monosaccharide danced gracefully, refusing to break down into simpler sugars.
meanings.sent5: Picture a monosaccharide as a tiny, indivisible sugar molecule.

meanings.definition: Any of the class of sugars that cannot be hydrolyzed to give a simpler sugar.
meanings.sent1: Fructose is a common monosaccharide in many fruits.
meanings.sent2: Our bodies quickly absorb monosaccharides for energy.
meanings.sent3: The monosaccharide and the polysaccharide had a sweet rivalry.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as pure and sweet as a monosaccharide.
meanings.sent5: Imagine a monosaccharide as a tiny, unbreakable sugar unit.
